docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 14 -- A demilitarized zone 20 kilometers (12.42 miles) wide between the armies of Bolivia and Paraguay in the Gran Chaco was proposed to those governments by the committee of neutrals today, coupled with an "urgent appeal" for...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 14 -- A demilitarized zone 20 kilometers (12.42 miles) wide between the armies of Bolivia and Paraguay in the Gran Chaco was proposed to those governments by the committee of neutrals today, coupled with an "urgent appeal" for immediate cessation of hostilities.
docs.abstract: Neutrals urge demilitarized zone in urgent appeal; battle at fort continues

headline.main: DEMILITARIZED ZONE URGED IN THE CHACO; Neutrals Send "Urgent Appeal" to Bolivia and Paraguay to End Hostilities at Once. WOULD WATCH RETIREMENT Mediators Advance Proposal as Basis for Negotiations for a Pacific Settlement. BATTLE CONTINUES AT FORT Fighting Enters Its Sixth Day With Both Armies Claiming Recap- ture of Boqueron.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES.WASHINGTON, Sept. 14

docs.snippet: PANAMA CITY, Sept. 14. -- A combination of the fiery impatience of President Luis Sanchez Cerro and the propaganda of the American Popular Revolutionary Alliance in the capitals of Latin America is isolating Peru in a manner that is compared to the...
docs.lead_paragraph: PANAMA CITY, Sept. 14. -- A combination of the fiery impatience of President Luis Sanchez Cerro and the propaganda of the American Popular Revolutionary Alliance in the capitals of Latin America is isolating Peru in a manner that is compared to the position of Soviet Russia, in an editorial in The Panama American.
docs.abstract: Apra propaganda against imprisonment of V R Haya de la Torre; Pres Sanchez Cerro condemned by Latin-Amer press

headline.main: APRA LEADERS STIR TROUBLE FOR PERU; Propaganda Evokes Protests Over Imprisonment of Haya de la Torre. CONDEMN SANCHEZ CERRO Latin American Press Refers to President as a "Tyrant" -- Con- grosses Take Action.

byline.original: By C.H. CALHOUN.Special Correspondence, THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: BORROWINGS DECLINE FOR MEMBER BANKS; $42,910,000 Drop Reported by Federal Reserve for Week, to $359,023,000. MONETARY GOLD STOCKS UP Rise $37,000,000 -- Circulation Shows More Than Seasonal Decrease of $26,000,000. LOANS TO BROKERS DOWN Off $25,000,000 to $408,000,000 -- Entire Change Due to Local Institutions. DROP IN BORROWINGS FOR MEMBER BANKS

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23. -- In identic notes to Bolivia and Paraguay the commission of neutrals has asked them to cease fighting over the Gran Chaco and accept a truce guaranteed by the presence of military representatives of neutral powers. The notes...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23. -- In identic notes to Bolivia and Paraguay the commission of neutrals has asked them to cease fighting over the Gran Chaco and accept a truce guaranteed by the presence of military representatives of neutral powers. The notes were sent yesterday and made public today.
docs.abstract: Identic notes sent by neutrals who urge truce and offer to outlaw aggressor if truce is agreed upon; Ft Falcon (Rojas Silva) recaptured by Paraguay; Bolivia accuses Paraguay of being aggressor

headline.main: CHACO TRUCE PLAN OUTLAWS AGGRESSOR; Neutrals Offer to Break Off With Violator if Bolivia and Paraguay Retire. ARMY REFEREES PROPOSED Washington Group Says They Could Inspect Lines by Plane Within a Few Hours. FORT FALCON RECAPTURED Asuncion Celebrates Victory at Key to Attack on Arce From South of Boqueron.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 24. -- In a session lasting until 3:30 o'clock this morning the Chamber of Deputies approved a measure legalizing divorce.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 24. -- In a session lasting until 3:30 o'clock this morning the Chamber of Deputies approved a measure legalizing divorce.
docs.abstract: Chamber of Deputies approves measure legalizing divorce

headline.main: Argentine Chamber Approves Divorce Bill After Wild Session Nearly Ending in Riot

docs.snippet: The return movement of gold to the United States, which Started after withdrawals on a large scale had ended in mid-June, became more pronounced in September, when, for the first month since May, 1931, there were no exports here, while imports...
docs.lead_paragraph: The return movement of gold to the United States, which Started after withdrawals on a large scale had ended in mid-June, became more pronounced in September, when, for the first month since May, 1931, there were no exports here, while imports increased steadily as the month advanced and included consignments from two countries that earlier in the year had reduced heavily their balances here.

headline.main: NO GOLD EXPORTED HERE IN SEPTEMBER; Return Movement to United States Showed Progressive Increase During Month. EARMARKING OFF SHARPLY Receipts at New York $20,837,300 -- Net Gain in Country's Stocks Was $97,096,500.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 30. -- The business situation abroad showed encouraging features in a number of foreign countries, but in others there was no improvement, the Bureau of Foreign Commerce showed today in its weekly survey of the foreign situation.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 30. -- The business situation abroad showed encouraging features in a number of foreign countries, but in others there was no improvement, the Bureau of Foreign Commerce showed today in its weekly survey of the foreign situation.

headline.main: SIGHS ARE HOPEFUL FOR TRADE ABROAD; Encouraging Features in Some Countries Are Offset by Lack of Gains in Others. BRITISH IMPORTS INCREASE Sales In Canadian Prairie Provinces Grow -- Optimistic Tone Is Augmented in Mexico.
